de.nec.nle.siafu.model
Class Gradient

java.lang.Object
  de.nec.nle.siafu.model.Gradient
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Gradient
extends Object
implements Serializable

This class is used to generate and query the distance gradients that help the Siafu Agents to navigate. When an agent is ordered to head for a destination, it does so by following something close to the shortest route. This deviation from optimal is due to the discrete nature of the map Siafu uses. An agent can move only vertically, horizontally or diagonally on top of a checker board. In other words, if you were to walk on equal sizes steps, and always facing North, South, East, West, NE, NW, SW or SE, you'd take the same route. This is usually not a problem for more simulations, although all feedback is welcome. This quasi-shortest distance is determined by pre-calculating the distance from every single point in the map to the desired destination. We call this a distance gradient. The agent then knows what the new distance will be if he moves to each of the positions adjacent to his current position, and chooses the one that gets him closer to its target. The gradient is calculated by growing distances from the destination point. To do so, we calulate the distance from the target point to each of the adjacent pixels. You can picture this as a 3d surface, where the height is the distance to the destination point. If there were no wall,s this would be the inside of an inverted cone. To walk the agent simply follows the direction of biggest gradient (slope). When the distance grows from the center, we consider the walls in the map, and so the optimal routes are calculated.

Author:
Miquel Martin

Field Detail

UNREACHABLE

public static final int UNREACHABLE
The distance to a place that is unreachable. It is inferior to any other distance, and equal to the maximum interger value possible. A wall is unreachable. So is an area completely surrounded by walls.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

Gradient

public Gradient(Position center,
                World world)
Creates a full map gradient, which knows the distance from any point in the map to pos.

Parameters:
center - the gradient's center, that is, the position we want to reach from anywhere on the map
world - the world where we need to navigate

Gradient

public Gradient(Position center,
                World world,
                Position relevantPos)
Creates a gradient (distance from points to pos).However, this is not a full map gradient, since the calculation ceases when we reach the desired point. If that point is not reachable, then the end result is a full map. There is now way to guarantee that a gradient created with this method will or will not be a full map gradient. This is used, for instance, in the case of the user manually directing an Agent to an arbitrary point. Because the gradient will never be used again, there's no need to perform the full calculation.

Parameters:
center - the gradient's center, that is, the position we want to reach from anywhere on the map
relevantPos - the position where we start in order to go to the gradient's center
world - the world where we need to navigate

pointFrom

public int pointFrom(Position pos,
                     int preferredDir)
Get the direction towards which an agent should walk in order to reach the gradient center fastest. If more than one direction yields the same distance, and one of them is the preferred dir, then the preferred dir is returned. Otherwise, the first optimal one is returned.

Parameters:
pos - the position from which we want to move to the center
preferredDir - if more than one way is optimal, prefer this one. If preferredDir is -1, there is no preferred dir
Returns:
the direction to follow

pointFrom

public int pointFrom(Position pos)
Returns the direction towards the center of the gradient or -1 if we are already there.

Parameters:
pos - the position for which we want to know the optimal direction towards the gradient center
Returns:
the optimal direction or -1 if the destination has been reached

distanceFrom

public int distanceFrom(Position pos)
Return the distance in simulation grid points between pos and the gradient's center.

Parameters:
pos - the position to calculate the distance from
Returns:
the distance in simulation gridpoints
